translated: And that is said to be not properly grasped here due to being in a karmadhāraya compound. But the object of injunction mentioned first in a bahuvrihi compound is understood as the object of injunction itself.

analyzed: yathā vapuḥ virūpa akṣam iti atra vairūpyasya
translated: As in the sentence The form of the three-eyed one, the ugliness of the eye is [understood].

original: nirmṛṣṭarāgo 'dharaityatra rāge nirmṛṣṭatvasya citragurityatra gavicitratvasya ca vidheyasya vidheyatayaiva sārvalaukikī pratītiḥ /
analyzed: nirmṛṣṭa rāgaḥ dharā eti atra rāge nirmṛṣṭa tvasya citraguḥ iti atra gavi citra tvasya ca vidheyasya vidheya tayā eva sārvalaukikī pratītiḥ
translated: In the sentence The lip devoid of passion, the state of being devoid of passion [is understood]. In the sentence The variegated cow, the state of being variegated [is understood]. The universally accepted understanding is that what is to be enjoined is to be enjoined.

original: na tu karmadhāraye vidheyapāte tadavimarśa iti satyam /
analyzed: na tu karmadhāraye vidheya pāte tad avimarśaḥ iti satyam
translated: It is true that in a karmadhāraya compound, when the enjoined [element] is present, it is not considered.

original: kintu yadi vidheyamuddeśyānvayi bhavati /🔽yathā agre udāhariṣyaṇāme /
analyzed: kintu yadi vidheyam uddeśya anvayi bhavati  yathā agre udāhariṣyaṇāme
translated: But if what is to be enjoined is related to the object of the injunction,🔽as we will cite later.

original: ṣaṣṭhabāṇa iva pañcaśarasyaityatra bāṇe uddeśye 'nvayi ṣaṣṭhatvaṃ vidheyamavimṛṣṭam /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭha bāṇaḥ iva pañcaśarasya eti atra bāṇe uddeśye nvayi ṣaṣṭha tvam vidheyam avimṛṣṭam
translated: In the sentence The sixth arrow of the five-arrowed one, the sixth-ness, which is to be enjoined, is not considered in the arrow, which is the object.

original: yatra tūddeśyatāvacchedake vidheyamanveti tatra vidheyatayaiva pratīteḥ ānubhāvikatvānna doṣaḥ /
analyzed: yatra tu uddeśya tā avacchedake vidheyam anveti tatra vidheya tayā eva pratīteḥ ānubhāvika tvāt na doṣaḥ
translated: But where what is to be enjoined is related to the differentia of the object, there, because of the understanding as to be enjoined, there is no fault due to its being a natural consequence.

original: yathāeṣvayamatyanvapaṇḍitaityatra atyantasya vidheyasya uddeśyatāvacchedake pāṇḍitye evānvayo vidheyatayaiva pratītiḥ /
analyzed: yathā eṣu ayam atyanva paṇḍitaḥ iti atra atyantasya vidheyasya uddeśya tā avacchedake pāṇḍitye eva anvayaḥ vidheya tayā eva pratītiḥ
translated: As in the sentence He is very learned in this, the extreme, which is to be enjoined, is related to learning, which is the differentia of the object, and is understood as to be enjoined.

original: evaṃnitāntasundarīkāntāityatrāpi saundarye 'nvitasya nitāntatvasya evaanirddayopabhogasya rūpasya mṛdunaḥ kathaṃ /
analyzed: evam nitānta sundarī kāntā iti atra api saundarye nvitasya nitānta tvasya eva a nirddaya upabhogasya rūpasya mṛdunaḥ katham
translated: How can the tender form of merciless enjoyment

original: kaṭhinaṃ khalu te cetaḥ śirīṣasyeva bandhanam //
analyzed: kaṭhinam khalu te cetaḥ śirīṣasya iva bandhanam
translated: Be like the hard bondage of a Sirisha flower?

analyzed: iti atra upabhoge uddeśya tā avacchedake nvitasya anirddaya tvasya vidheya tayā iva pratītiḥ ānubhāvikī
translated: Here, the mercilessness, which is related to the object to be accomplished in enjoyment, is understood only as the thing to be enjoined, not naturally.

original: tathā ca prakṛte 'pi ucchūnatvena uddeśyatāvacchedakenānvitasya vṛthātvasya kathamavimṛṣṭatvam / ucchūnabhuje vṛthātvasya tu kiṃpadenaiva uktatvāt🔽yattu kāvyaprakāśakṛtā asyaiva ślokasya prathamacaraṇenyakkāro hyayameva me yadahayaḥ' /
analyzed: tathā ca prakṛte pi ucchūna tvena uddeśya tā avacchedakena anvitasya vṛthātvasya katham avimṛṣṭa tvam ucchūna bhuje vṛthātvasya tu kiṃpadena eva ukta tvāt  yat tu kāvyaprakāśa kṛtā asya eva ślokasya prathama caraṇe nyakkāraḥ hi ayam eva me yat ahayaḥ
translated: And so, in the present case also, how can the uselessness, which is related to the object to be accomplished by inflation, be unreflected upon? But the uselessness of inflated arms is stated by the word what itself.

analyzed: iti atra vākya gatam vidheya avimarśam udāharati
translated: As for what the author of the Kāvyādarśa cites the first line of this very verse as an example of the non-reflection of the object to be accomplished in a sentence, in This very disregard of mine is that I am a serpent,

original: atra caraṇe ucchūnatvamātraṃ cānuvādyaṃ natu vṛthātvaviśeṣitamityuktam /
analyzed: atra caraṇe ucchūna tva mātram ca anuvādyam na tu vṛthātva viśeṣitam iti uktam
translated: Here, it is said that only inflation is to be referred to in this line, not qualified by uselessness.

analyzed: tena vidheya avimarśa doṣaḥ vidheye darśitaḥ
translated: Therefore, the fault of non-reflection of the object to be accomplished is shown with respect to the object to be accomplished.

analyzed: vākye doṣa pradarśana prastāve samāsa gata doṣa pradarśana anupayogāt samāsa gatasya darśita tvāt
translated: Because in the context of showing the faults in a sentence, it is not useful to show the faults in a compound, and the example of a compound, such as mūrdhāvudvṛtta-kṛttā etc., has already been shown.

analyzed: kintu prasaṅgāt abhavat mata yoga doṣaḥ eva darśitaḥ
translated: But the fault of non-existent agreement has been shown incidentally.

original: tathā hi svargaviluṇṭhane ucchūnatvameva janyate natu tad vṛthātvaṃ vṛthātvaviśeṣitamucchūnatvaṃ vā /
analyzed: tathā hi svarga viluṇṭhane ucchūna tvam eva janyate na tu tat vṛthātvam vṛthātva viśeṣitam ucchūna tvam vā
translated: For thus, in the plundering of heaven, only inflation is produced, not its futility or inflation qualified by futility.

analyzed: ucchūna tva vṛthātvasya rāmeṇa laṅkā veṣṭanāt eva jāta tvāt
translated: Because inflation and futility have already arisen from Rama's encirclement of Lanka.

original: ato viluṇṭhanasya janakatāsambandhena vṛthocchūnatve 'nanvayādabhavanmatayogadoṣa eva darśitaḥ na cābhavanmatadoṣasya vākyamātragāmitvameva
analyzed: atas viluṇṭhanasya janaka tā sambandhena vṛthā ucchūna tve nanu ayāt abhavat mata yoga doṣaḥ eva darśitaḥ na ca abhavat mata doṣasya vākya mātra gāmi tvam eva
translated: Therefore, since plundering is not related to the relation of being a producer with futile inflation, the fault of non-existent agreement has been shown, and the fault of non-existent agreement does not belong only to a sentence.

analyzed: tena uktam katham
translated: So how can it be said?

analyzed: samāsa eka pade tad sambhavam iti vācyam
translated: It should be said that it is possible in a single compound word.

analyzed: samāsasya pada tva vākya tva ubhaya sattvāt asamasta pada gāmi tva abhāvasya tad abhiprate tvāt
translated: Because a compound exists both as a word and a sentence, and its absence of belonging to a non-compound word is intended.

analyzed: tathā ca atra avimṛṣṭa tvam na asti eva iti atas
translated: And thus, there is no non-discrimination here at all. Therefore, he cites another example.

analyzed: locanā

analyzed: atra vṛthātvam iti

analyzed: samāse tatpuruṣa samāse guṇībhāvāt

original: ayamāśayaḥ tatpuruṣasamāse uttarapadasyaiva prādhānyāt vṛtheti pūrvapadasya vidheyasya prādhānyenānirddeśādavimṛṣṭavidheyāṃśo doṣaḥ /
analyzed: ayam āśayaḥ tatpuruṣa samāse uttara padasya eva prādhānyāt vṛthā iti pūrva padasya vidheyasya prādhānyena anirddeśāt avimṛṣṭa vidheya aṃśaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: The idea is: in a tatpurusha compound, because only the latter term is primary, there is a fault of the subordinate part not being considered, because the prior term to be enjoined is not stated as primary with the word vṛthā.

translated: But here, even the small part of deviation is not intended to be accomplished by the addition of the word 'api' (even).🔽In the compound 'vyatikramasya', the genitive case is used to indicate the connection with deviation, and the large part related to deviation can be understood, not 'even the small part of deviation'.

original: samāse tadā vyatikramalavaṃ padārthantaramapītyevamva bodhodayādato 'troccāraṇenādhyāhāreṇāvaśyaṃ vācyasyānabhidhānam /

analyzed: nyūna pada tve vācaka padasya eva nyūna tā vivakṣitā

analyzed: apeḥ tu na tathātvam iti anayoḥ bhedaḥ  vijña priyā

In the case of the fault of having more or less words, etc., it is to be understood first by the cognition of the connection of the meanings of words.

analyzed: rāma manmatha śareṇa

analyzed: ityādau iti anantaram artha pratīti anantara boddhyatve pi iti śeṣaḥ

original: aślīlatvādāvitihantumevetyādau kvacid vākyavyāpitve 'pi kvacid vivaraiṣiṇa ityādau padaniṣṭatve 'pi sambhavānna vākyadoṣatetyarthaḥ /

translated: The meaning is that even when there is pervasion of the sentence in some cases like 'to kill' etc. due to vulgarity, and even when there is dependence on the word in some cases like 'desiring gaps' etc., it is not a fault of the sentence, because it is possible.

analyzed: ānandita sva pakṣaḥ sau para pakṣān haniṣyati

analyzed: vi taḥ vidhi ayukta tvam āha ānandita iti

analyzed: vidheya tātparyyāpti ayogye tātparyya arpaṇam tattvam

original: atra parapakṣahananānantarameva svapakṣānandadānavidhāveva vidheyatātparyyāptyaucityaṃ natu parapakṣahananavidhau ityarthaḥ /

translated: Here, in the injunction to give delight to one's own side after killing the other side, there is fitness for the object of the purport, but not in the injunction to kill the other side. This is the meaning.

original: na cātra vidheyāvimarśa iti vācyam /🔽tatra vidheyatā na pratīyate atra tu pratītividheyatāke /

analyzed: tātparyyāpti anaucityam iti bhedāt

analyzed: caṇḍīśa cūḍā bhāraṇa

analyzed: candra

analyzed: lokatamā upaha

analyzed: virahi prāṇa haraṇa

analyzed: kadarthaya na mām vṛthā

analyzed: vijña priyā

analyzed: anuvāda ayukta tām āha caṇḍīśa iti

original: lagnaṃ rāgāvṛtāṅgyā sadṛḍhamiha yathaivāsiyaṣṭyāparikaṇṭhe mātaṅgānāmapīhopari parapuruṣairyā ca dṛṣṭā patantī /

translated: Just as a sword-staff, covered with passion, is firmly placed here around the neck of the elephants, and which is seen falling here by the men of other countries,

analyzed: rasasya iti atra sthāyibhāvasya iti arthāt

translated: Because it is mentioned separately just by the difference in the denotative words, the permanent mood being mentioned by the word rasa denoting rasa etc. and by the word sthāyibhāva.🔽For this very reason, the author of the Kāvyādarśa has written that the permanent mood alone is mentioned here by the word rasa.

translated: And that attainment occurs only when it is to be manifested by a sentence without any expectancy.

analyzed: yathā a lajjā namra mukhī priyeṇa hasatā bālā ciram cumbane vidheye lajjāyāḥ bhāva tā prāpti yogya tām anāpannāyāḥ

analyzed: locanā

analyzed: iha ca yatra ekatra vyabhicāriṇām anubhāva mukhena varṇanam sva śabdena tu abhidhānam

analyzed: kintu adhika pada ākhyaḥ vākyadoṣaḥ pi

analyzed: na virodhaḥ  vijña priyā

analyzed: vi ma kavi gatā kavi niṣṭhā pradhānam

analyzed: tasya utsāhasya karuṇaḥ ṅgam iti anvayaḥ

analyzed: aṅgirasaḥ tāvat nirākāṅkṣa vidheya vākyāt prādurbhavati

translated: But the remembered and the simile arise only from sentences that express what is to be desired and have a desire, so there is no simultaneity in the form of the occurrence of a single sentence, and there is no possibility of mutual suppression. This is the meaning.

analyzed: dvayoḥ api pūrṇa tayā svātantryeṇa viśrānteḥ
